task

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • task.Task

  • public class Task
extends java.lang.Object
    This class works to creates a task from the inputs entered in the ToDoListManager class. It sets the name, priority and isComplete boolean of the Task, and ensures the inputs are valid. It also creates a string representation of the class.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Nathan M. Abbey;

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Task()
      This default constructor sets the title to "No Title" and the priority to "No Priority".
      Task(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String priority)
      This constructor sets title and priority of the task after verifying appropriate input from user.
      Task(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String priority, boolean isComplete)
      This overloaded constructor verifies and accepts all 3 task parameters.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String createTabRecord()
      This method creates and returns a string representation of the class with the variables separated by tabs.
      boolean getIsComplete()
      This method returns the valid task isComplete value inputed by the user.
      java.lang.String getPriority()
      This method returns the task priority inputed.
      java.lang.String getTitle()
      This method returns the name of the task.
      void setIsComplete(boolean isComplete)
      This method sets the isComplete boolean to either true or false depending on user input.
      void setPriority(java.lang.String priority)
      This method verifies the Priority value is valid and sets it.
      void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
      This method verifies the Task name is valid and sets it.
      java.lang.String toString()
      This method returns a string representation of the class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Task

        public Task()
        This default constructor sets the title to "No Title" and the priority to "No Priority".
        Since:
        1.0

      • Task

        public Task(java.lang.String title,
            java.lang.String priority)
     throws ValidationException
        This constructor sets title and priority of the task after verifying appropriate input from user.
        Parameters:
        title - name of the task
        priority - importance of task will be high, medium, or low
        Throws:
        ValidationException - ensures title and priority are valid entries and will display a message informing the user if this is not the case.
        Since:
        1.0

      • Task

        public Task(java.lang.String title,
            java.lang.String priority,
            boolean isComplete)
     throws ValidationException
        This overloaded constructor verifies and accepts all 3 task parameters.
        Parameters:
        title - name of the task
        priority - importance of task will be high, medium, or low
        isComplete - boolean which will be true (is complete) or false (isn't complete)
        Throws:
        ValidationException - ensures title, priority, and isComplete boolean is correct. Will respond to an incorrect input by displaying an appropriate message.
        Since:
        1.0

    • Method Detail

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()
        This method returns the name of the task.
        Returns:
        title - name of the task
        Since:
        1.0

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
              throws ValidationException
        This method verifies the Task name is valid and sets it. Meaning it is not null, empty, exceeding 25 characters, or contains tabs.
        Parameters:
        title - name of the task
        Throws:
        ValidationException - ensures title is not empty, null, greater than 25 characters or contain any tab characters in it. If so, it will display an appropriate message informing the user of the problem.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getPriority

        public java.lang.String getPriority()
        This method returns the task priority inputed.
        Returns:
        priority - importance of task will be high, medium, or low
        Since:
        1.0

      • createTabRecord

        public java.lang.String createTabRecord()
        This method creates and returns a string representation of the class with the variables separated by tabs.
        Returns:
        tabString - String with the variables separated by tabs
        Since:
        1.0

      • setPriority

        public void setPriority(java.lang.String priority)
                 throws ValidationException
        This method verifies the Priority value is valid and sets it. Meaning it's not null, empty, and is set to either high, medium, or low.
        Parameters:
        priority - importance of task will be high, medium, or low
        Throws:
        ValidationException - ensures priority is not null, empty, and either high, medium or low. If not it will display an appropriate message to the user informing them of the mistake.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getIsComplete

        public boolean getIsComplete()
        This method returns the valid task isComplete value inputed by the user.
        Returns:
        isComplete - boolean which will be true (is complete) or false (isn't complete)
        Since:
        1.0

      • setIsComplete

        public void setIsComplete(boolean isComplete)
        This method sets the isComplete boolean to either true or false depending on user input.
        Parameters:
        isComplete - boolean which will be true (is complete) or false (isn't complete)
        Since:
        1.0

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method returns a string representation of the class. If isComplete is true it will append "is complete" to the string, if isComplete is false it will append "is not complete" to the string.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        sb.toString() - a string consisting of the title, followed by the priority in brackets, followed by the isComplete boolean which appends either "is complete" for true; or "is not complete" for false.
        Since:
        1.0
